title: Troy McCarthy
text:
Troy Robert McCarthy (born 14 December 1966) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played for <a href="Gold%20Coast%20Chargers">Gold Coast</a> in the NSWRL.
Biography.
McCarthy, a Queensland junior representative, was a foundation player for the Gold Coast in the <a href="1988%20NSWRL%20season">1988 NSWRL season</a>. Then known as Gold Coast-Tweed, the club was coached by his father, Australian former representative <a href="Bob%20McCarthy">Bob McCarthy</a>.
From 1988 to 1993, McCarthy made 45 first-grade appearances for the Gold Coast, mostly as a centre and full-back.
During his time with the Gold Coast he also had a stint in England playing for the <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>, in the <a href="1991%E2%80%9392%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1991–92 Championship</a>.
He has an elder brother, <a href="Darren%20McCarthy%20%28rugby%20league%29">Darren McCarthy</a>, who played for South Sydney and Canterbury.
His coaching career includes a <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a> premiership with the <a href="Tweed%20Heads%20Seagulls">Tweed Heads Seagulls</a> to 2007.
